citation.article-title: Marinococcus halotolerans sp. nov., isolated from Qinghai, north-west China
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Marinococcus halotolerans sp. nov.

Marinococcus halotolerans (ha.lo.to′le.rans. Gr. n. hals salt; L. pres. part. tolerans tolerating; N.L. part. adj. halotolerans referring to the ability of the organism to tolerate high salt concentrations).
Aerobic, Gram-positive, non-spore-forming, motile, spherical with a single polar flagellum; cell diameter is about 1·0–1·2 μm.
The colony colour on most media tested is orange.
Colonies are circular, opaque and approximately 1·5–1·8 mm in diameter after 24 h at 28 °C.
The optimum concentration of MgCl2.6H2O for growth is 10 % (w/v) (MgCl2.6H2O can also be substituted by NaCl or KCl).
The optimum growth pH and temperature are 7·0–7·5 and 28 °C, respectively.
Concentration ranges of MgCl2.6H2O, NaCl and KCl for growth are 0–20, 0–25 and 0–25 %, respectively.
Catalase-positive and oxidase-negative.

Positive for nitrate reduction, but negative for gelatin liquefaction, ammonia production, in methyl red and Voges–Proskauer tests, and for milk peptonization and coagulation, growth on cellulose, H2S and melanin production, casein and starch hydrolysis.
The following substrates are utilized: maltose, mannitol, glucose, mannose, fructose, cellobiose, salicin, acetamide, galactose, xylose and dextrin.
Adonitol, arabinose, arabitol, rhamnose, inositol and sorbitol are not utilized.
Acid is produced from aesculin, glucose and mannitol.
The peptidoglycan type is A1γ (meso-diaminopimelic acid directly cross-linked).
The phospholipids contain phosphatidylinositol and diphosphatidylglycerol.
The menaquinones are MK-7 (91·6 %) and MK-6 (8·4 %).
The DNA G+C content is 48·5 mol% (HPLC method).
Isolated from a saline soil sample collected from Qinghai, north-west China.
The type strain is YIM 70157T (=DSM 16375T=KCTC 19045T).
